alert.note: Alert for Lee; Pontotoc; Prentiss; Tippah; Union (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 14 at 5:20AM CST until December 14 at 1:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Mississippi, including the following counties, Lee, Pontotoc, Prentiss, Tippah and Union. * WHEN...Until 630 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 520 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tupelo, Booneville, Pontotoc, Baldwyn, Trace State Park, Saltillo, Guntown, Ecru, Jumpertown, New Harmony, Furrs, Troy, Blair, Randolph, Wheeler, Sherman, Thaxton, Algoma, Blue Springs and Endville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
